intro: Aporuellia acaulis f. glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous stemless aporuellia, is a rare and specialized plant species belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its lack of a distinct stem, with the leaves directly emerging from the root system. The plant exhibits a glabrous or nearly hairless surface, which is a distinguishing feature of this particular form. It typically thrives in specific microhabitats, often in moist, shaded environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphological traits, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
